column4: could someone PLEASE tell me if ubuntu has a multi account chat/im client similar to empathy but with voice and video chat?
pidgin?.. don't think so.
only thing i'm aware of, is aMSN.. if you guys want to create MSN accounts
good luck...
? neither? it's ubuntu 10.04
ok sorry for the dumb question i didn't know as i'm only three weeks into using linux/ubuntu
well what exactly are you trying to download?... you should really try to use the package manager

package manager doesnt have what i'm looking for. http://www.technixupdate.com/download-yahoo-messenger-for-ubuntu-linux-with-webcam-voice-chat-photo-sharing-support/ it's supposed to be yahoo messenger
hmm, i guess if i was gonna try one of those, I'd try the Jaunty package
ok thank you
hang on a sec...
ok
hmm, seems the jaunty packages ar emissing.
so i'm guessing there is going to be no way i can get yahoo voice and video chat on ubuntu then
there has to be an ubuntu package around somewhere
Reason it's so important is my brother and alot of my old squad are still in afghan and all use yahoo vid chat
yeah, i understand
i've been searching for two weeks and thats all i can find though. any ideas on where else to look?
https://launchpad.net/~loell/+archive/ppa

PPA repository for gyachi...
